column1: FIR001-DN408372-06883269,Contract,"Knowsley Housing Trust",Awarded,2019-09-16T10:48:06Z,"Insurance and Related Services","The First Ark Group consists of seven companies that work together with the over-riding purpose of making a real positive difference to our communities and to people's lives. Ins01,Contract,"BURNLEY BOROUGH COUNCIL",Awarded,2020-03-24T14:51:54Z,"Insurance Services","The Council's requirement is for the provision of insurance cover and insurance services  (including claims handling)  for its current insurance portfolio and new covers as identified within the ITT document. This requirement will be let in 8 Lots as follows; Lot 1 Property and Pecuniary Insurances (including Contract Works, Business Interruption, Money and All Risks); Lot 2 Property Owners; Lot 3 Casualty Section; Lot 4 Fidelity Guarantee; Lot 5 Motor Fleet; Lot 6 Personal Accident & Travel; Lot 7 Combined Engineering; Lot 8 Towneley Hall Fine Arts Museum.

Tenderers may submit a tender response for a single Lot or a combination of Lots. The Council reserves the right to award a single Lot or a combination of Lots by applying, to the tender response to each Lot submitted, the evaluation methodology set out in Appendix 2 of the ITT document. Awarded lots will be for 3 years from 1st April 2020 with the option of two annual extensions of 1 year each to 31st March 2025.",,,"North West","66510000 ","Chris Gay",cgay@burnley.gov.uk,"Town Hall, Manchester Rd, Burnley, Lancashire",,BURNLEY,"BB11 9SA",England,01282477163,,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=6bc05142-74ea-e911-80fa-005056b64545 ","This is an OJEU open procedure, OJEU notice temp ref 19-497150-001

Tender documents can be accessed at www.the-chest.org.uk Oppurtunity ID: DN440785 https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=6bc05142-74ea-e911-80fa-005056b64545  Tender submissions must also be via the Chest.
Awarded Lots will be for 3 years from 1st April 2020 with the option of two annual extensions of 1 year each to 31st March 2025.
Tenders may be submitted for one, for several or for all Lots.

The Council reserves the right to award a single Lot or a combination of Lots by applying, to the tender response to each Lot submitted, the evaluation methodology as set out in the ITT documentation.
Contract renewals will be determined based upon the duration of the awarded contract(s) including any options for extension.
The estimated contract values for the 3 year term are as follows:
Lot 1 Property and Pecuniary Insurances (including Contract Works, Business Interruption, Money and All Risks) £150,000
Lot 8 Towneley Hall Fine Arts Museum £105,000
OJEU temporary award notice reference number 20-149520-001.",01/04/2020,31/03/2023,18/11/2019,YES,Ins01,Yes,No,No,Services,829000,,10/03/2020,507061,"[Zurich Insurance PLC

P0432 - AWARD,Contract,"Birmingham City Council",Awarded,2018-05-15T15:52:09Z,"P0432 - Renewal of Various Insurance Policies  - AWARD","Birmingham City Council are inviting organisations to tender for the renewal of Insurance Policies for the following:
The following will consist of four lots:

Lot 1 - Employers Liability - Provides the Council with an indemnity against its legal liability to compensate those employees who sustain either a personal injury or contract an illness or disease during the course of their employment.

Lot 2 - Motor Insurance - Provides cover on a comprehensive basis for both damage to Council motor vehicles, together with an indemnity in respect of the Council's legal liability to compensate motorists or third parties for any personal injury or damage to their property as a result of motor vehicle accidents.
Lot 3 - Acivico Insurance - Public Liability, Employers Liability, Property, Motor and Cash and Fidelity Guarantee policies
Lot 4 - Children's Trust Insurance - Public Liability, Employers Liability, Property, Motor and Cash and Fidelity Guarantee policies
Cover is to commence on 1st April 2018 and run to 31st March 2019.  A three year long term agreement may be considered in respect of this policy.

BCC will be using its e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and providers must register with the system to be able to express an interest.  The web address is: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc

Registration and use of In-tend is free. All correspondence for this procurement process must be via the In-tend correspondence function. If you are unable to register with In-tend please either email cps@birmingham.gov.uk or call 0121 464 8000.

If you are interested in tendering please click on the following link to access Birmingham City Councils tender Portal: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register as a bidder. We will send you a log on and password so you can download the questionnaire. Requests to participate must be by way of completion and return of the questionnaire no later than 12:00 hours on 7th February 2018 using the Supplier Portal.",,"B4 7WB","West Midlands","66510000 66516000 66516100 ","Marie Hadley",marie.m.hadley@birmingham.gov.uk,"10 Woodcock Street",Birmingham,"West Midlands","B4 7WB","United Kingdom","0121 303 7746",,,,,01/04/2018,31/03/2021,07/02/2018,NO,,No,No,No,Services,0,,28/03/2018,0,"[Zurich Insurance Plc

RM 3731 - AWARD,Contract,"Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council",Awarded,2018-03-27T15:59:54Z,"Further Competition under the Crown Commercial Service Insurance Services Framework ll (Lot 1) Leasehold Properties - AWARD","Further Competition under the Crown Commercial Service Insurance Services Framework ll (Lot 1) Leasehold Properties - RM 3731

The Contracting Authority wishes to establish a long-term relationship with the successful Economic Operator and is therefore looking for a reliable company with a proven track record in the provision of Leasehold Properties Insurance

Evaluations will be undertaken by Marsh Ltd (who is facilitating the procurement on behalf of the Contracting Authority) in conjunction with the Contracting Authority. Both will follow a systematic and comprehensive process in accordance with the Contracting Authority's procedures and relevant legislation.
The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to the ITT and other related documents.
In Order To View the On-Line Questionnaire and Submit a Tender, you will be required to` Opt-In`.

Please be mindful that if you are cut and pasting your question responses onto the On-Line Questionnaire that you do so from a notepad document, this is due to the fact that some special characters are not accepted within the On-Line Questionnaire.

For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810.

Closing date: XXXXXXXXXXXXX 2018 at 15:00hrs",,"B69 3DB","West Midlands","66510000 66515200 ","Carole Le Roux",carole_leroux@sandwell.gov.uk,"Freeth Street",Oldbury,"West Midlands","B69 3DB","United Kingdom","0121 569 3628",,,,,04/04/2018,31/03/2021,16/02/2018,NO,,No,No,No,Services,0,,20/02/2018,0,"[Zurich Insurance Plc

column1: 0f6b1d28-b093-49fa-99ca-cc34cd53fb0f,Contract,"Crescent Purchasing Consortium (CPC)",Awarded,2020-06-29T17:01:10Z,"CA7367 - Provision of Insurance and Associated Services for Academies and Schools","The CPC is seeking to establish a Framework Agreement through which its current and future Members may procure insurance and/or insurance-related services directly from insurers, or via brokers, or a mixture of both.  The arrangements will replace the previous very successful framework developed by CPC and Risk2Value for the Academies sector.\
The framework will be of primary use by CPC's Academies & Schools members. Details of CPC's membership can be found here: https://www.thecpc.ac.uk/members/regions.php.\
Future members of the CPC will be from the education sector, with details available here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/get-information-about-schools\
Lot 1: Lot 1 - Comprehensive Insurance Cover & Service Provision\
Lot 2: Lot 2 - All Covers not included in the Risk Protection Arrangement (RPA)\
Login to https://suppliers.multiquote.com and view the opportunity CA7367.\
Visit https://suppliers.multiquote.com then register and quote CA7367 as the reason for registration. \

Any queries please contact MultiQuote on 0151 482 9230.",,"M6 6AJ","Any region","66510000 ","Gary Sadler",support@multiquote.com,"Unit 23, Leslie Hough way","Leslie Hough Way",Salford,"M6 6AJ",England,"0151 482 9230",https://suppliers.multiquote.com,,,,07/09/2020,06/09/2022,07/09/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Works,50000000,50000000,24/09/2020,1,"[FE Protect Ltd

column1: LGSS001-DN349507-59777718,Contract,"LGSS Insurance and Northamptonshire County Council on behalf of The Police and Crime Commissioner for Northamptonshire",Awarded,2019-01-03T10:23:05Z,"Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Insurance Programme 2018","LGSS Insurance and Northamptonshire County Council  on behalf of the Northamptonshire Police and Crime Commissioner (The ""Authority"") wishes to invite Tenders for the supply of services in respect of Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Insurance Programme and Claims Management Services as detailed within this tender documentation.

Arthur J. Gallagher has been selected by LGSS Insurance to assist in the tender of the Northamptonshire Fire Service Insurance programme. As noted above, the Fire Service will cease to be under the control of Northamptonshire CC from the 1 October, 2018, which means the Fire Service will require its own insurance programme from that date
Please note that this does not stop other entities of Arthur J. Gallagher bidding from any of lots detailed in this notice.
Please note that not all lots stated shall be awarded and LGSS Insurance reserve the right to award the lots as necessary and against the evaluation criteria stated in the documentation.

It is difficult to predict the exact value of this contract as the Authorities' requirements as this is the first time that the service has been tendered in its own right and risk profile may vary over the contract term, but it is estimated that the total value over the contract lifecycle will be estimated to be in the region of between £800,000 and £2,500,000.",,,"East Midlands","66000000 ","Mark Greenall",procurement@northamptonshire.gov.uk,"Shire Hall","Castle Hill",Cambridge,"CB3 0AP",England,"+44 1223699112",https://www.lgss.co.uk/about/,,,"Lot 1	Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Property Insurance
Lot 2	Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Works in Progress  Insurance
Lot 3	Northamptonshire Fire and  Rescue Service  Terrorism Insurance
Lot 4	Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Liability Insurance
Lot 5	Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Airside Insurance
Lot 6	Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Crime Insurance
Lot 7	Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Personal Accident/Business Travel Insurance
Lot 8	Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Computer Insurance
Lot 9	Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Engineering Inspection & Insurance
Lot 10	Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Motor Fleet Insurance
Lot 11	Northamptonshire  Fire and Rescue Marine Insurance

Lot 12	Northamptonshire Fire and Rescue Service Package Insurance Covering the following: Material Damage, Business Interruption, Specified All Risks, Works in Progress Insurance, Employer's Liability, Public/Products Liability, Officials Indemnity, Professional Indemnity, Crime Insurance, Personal Accident/Business Travel Insurance, Computer Insurance, Engineering Inspection & Insurance, Motor Fleet Insurance

column1: UOS/Insurance/0116 - AWARD,Contract,"University of Sunderland",Awarded,2016-08-09T14:47:03Z,"University of Sunderland - Insurance Services (excluding broker services) - AWARD","Expressions of interest are invited from F.C.A Authorised insurance companies and/or discretionary mutuals only.
Potential suppliers will be asked to complete a confidentiality agreement prior to the tender documents being released.  The contract notice duration has been increased by 5 days to accommodate this.
Please submit both your PQQ and ITT returns by 20th May 2016
The University is seeking to confirm value for money contract of insurance, from FSA authorised insurance companies or discretionary mutuals.  Cover is being sought in the following areas:-
Lot 1 – Material Damage Business Interruption & Contract Works
Lot 2 – Employers Liability, Public & Products Liability including hirers liability
Lot 5 - Fidelity Guarantee with crime cover option
Lot 9 – Combined lot covering all of the above (One stop shop for lots 1-8)

column1: P235 - AWARD,Contract,"Birmingham City Council",Awarded,2018-05-16T12:31:08Z,"P235 - Tender for the Renewal of various Insurance Policies  - AWARD","Birmingham City Council invites companies to tender for the renewal of the following insurance policies:
Lot 1A - Main Fire Policy (Including Terrorism Insurance)
Lot 1B - Main Fire Policy (Excluding Terrorism Insurance)
Lot 1C - Main Fire Policy Terrorism Insurance Only
Lot 2A - Industrial & Commercial Fire Policy (Including Terrorism Insurance)
Lot 2B - Industrial & Commercial Fire Policy (Excluding Terrorism Insurance)
Lot 2C - Industrial & Commercial Fire Policy (Terrorism Insurance Only)
Insurers are invited to submit a tender for either Lot(s) or sub- lots as indicated within the Tender Instructions.
Each lot will be awarded to one provider and will not be split by the individual insurance policies.
The annual premiums for each risk are due to commence on 1st April 2017 and the contract will run for a period of up to three years.
If you are interested in tendering please click on the following link to access Birmingham City Council's tender Portal:
https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register as a bidder. We will send you a log on and password so you can download the Invitation to Tender (ITT).

Your completed ITT should be returned by noon on 30th January 2017 using the Supplier Portal.",,"B4 7WB","West Midlands","66510000 66516000 66516400 66000000 66515100 ","Simone Beet",Simone.Beet@birmingham.gov.uk,"10 Woodcock Street",Birmingham,"West Midlands","B4 7WB","United Kingdom","0121 303 2813",,,,,01/04/2017,31/03/2020,30/01/2017,NO,,No,No,No,Services,0,,01/04/2017,0,"[Arthur J. column1: HCC1709478 - AWARD,Contract,"Supply Hertfordshire",Awarded,2018-08-29T13:08:41Z,"HCC Mar 17 Provision of Insurance Services - AWARD","Following a procurement, Hertfordshire County Council has awarded contracts for the Provision of Insurance Services.
This is an award notice and this opportunity is now closed.
Lot 3: Zurich Insurance plc (UK Branch) t/a Zurich Municipal
Lot 4: Zurich Insurance plc (UK Branch) t/a Zurich Municipal

The estimated total value of the contract is between £8,000,000 and £15,000,000 and is for the core contract period and also includes the approximate value for extensions. For the avoidance of doubt, the estimated annual contract value will be approximately £1,600,000 and £3,000,000.

This contract is for a core period of three (3) years, with the option to extend the contract up to a maximum of a further two (2) years on an annual basis. Please note that the contract requirements will be subject to available financial resources, supplier performance and flexibility to meet changing demands.
